column4: i have a seagate freeagent 500gb external hdd. It is partitioned to ext3, and if i take it and put it on windows it wont recognize it, how can i change that?
how can i change the partition of my external hdd from ext3 to ntfs?
you can't easily. Windows doesn't read/write ext3. I believe there are 3rd party drivers for ext3 for windows, http://www.fs-driver.org/. I've never used it. so at your own risk...
